Articles.Content: This new mod I am creating is going to use nova punch models but scaled and with different stats:D. It may be awhile:(. New fuel may come. Credit to the creator of nova punch for the models.

I advise not making threads until you have at least photos.

Also don't just take parts from other mods, learn how to make stuff on your own first.

Also you spelled aerospace wrong.

Edited August 23, 2015 by _Augustus_

I advise not making threads until you have at least photos.

rebalancing and rescaling is acceptable as long as proper attribution is given. For example just look at better than starting manned

Well, how ironic that we hear this from you!

Well, how ironic that we hear this from you!
I learned my lesson, and will now use my knowledge to help others.

I learned my lesson, and will now use my knowledge to help others.

Where you went wrong was putting yourself as a figurehead with no discernable contribution. Rebalancing itself is work game balance ain't no picnic and there for the lad here would appear to have earned a title once he releases something enjoyable.

Where you went wrong was putting yourself as a figurehead with no discernable contribution. Rebalancing itself is work game balance ain't no picnic and there for the lad here would appear to have earned a title once he releases something enjoyable.
But this is his first post...

But this is his first post...

Your point being what, exactly? How many posts must one have made before they should be allowed to try their hand at something? I've never seen a rule to such effect.

As long as copyrights are respected and things are done with honesty and integrity, there's really nothing to take issue with.

Edited August 23, 2015 by Jack Wolfe

Also you spelled aerospace wrong.
I want to see one day the mod that brings Oreospace into KSP.

I want to see one day the mod that brings Oreospace into KSP.
Agreed..

Let's chill, everyone

It is true that it is preferable to not swipe parts from other mods, even if the license on said mods says it's permissible. That said, it's fine if you want to borrow parts to get your alpha versions off the ground, which you can later replace with original part models. I just recommend, if you haven't already, that you check with the NovaPunch guys first to make sure they're okay with you redistributing their models in your own pack. It's a good start that you've given credit at least!
Okay, so we've now all put our 2 cents in. How about we let the OP get on with his/her project without further kibitzing?
Well that's a nice first page for him/her
Well I did not know how to post
This thread has been locked because of its age; however we all look forward to JamesBowser's forthcoming release.
